patterns: what do you mean by cyber crime
responses: Any illegal activity committed using a computer and/or the internet can be called a cyber crime
Any illegal activity committed using a computer and/or the internet can be called a cyber crime

patterns: what do you mean my digital forensics
responses: It is a branch of forensic science encompassing the recovery and investigation of material found in digital devices, often in relation to computer crime.

patterns: how many types of digital forensics
responses: Computer forensics. 2.Network forensics. 3.Digital Image forensics. 4.Mobile Device forensics. 5.Digital Audio/Video Forensics. 6.Memory Forensics.
The identification, preservation, collection, analysis and reporting on evidence found on computers, laptops and storage media in support of investigations and legal proceedings.

The monitoring, capture, storing and analysis of network activities or events in order to discover the source of security attacks, intrusions or other problem incidents, i.e. worms, virus or attacks, abnormal network traffic and security breaches.
The extraction and analysis of digitally acquired photographic images to validate their authenticity by recovering the metadata of the image file to ascertain its history.
The recovery of electronic evidence from mobile phones, smartphones, SIM cards, PDAs, GPS devices, tablets and game consoles.

patterns: what is Digital Audio Video Forensics
responses: The collection, analysis and evaluation of sound and video recordings. The science is the establishment of authenticity as to whether a recording is original and whether it has been tampered with, either maliciously or accidentally.
The recovery of evidence from the RAM of a running computer, also called live acquisition

patterns: what is Digital Audio Video Forensics
responses: The collection, analysis and evaluation of sound and video recordings. The science is the establishment of authenticity as to whether a recording is original and whether it has been tampered with, either maliciously or accidentally.

patterns: what is Digital Audio Video Forensics
responses: The collection, analysis and evaluation of sound and video recordings. The science is the establishment of authenticity as to whether a recording is original and whether it has been tampered with, either maliciously or accidentally.

patterns: what are the types of cyber crime
responses: 1. Hacking 2. Denial of Service (DoS) attack 3. Trojan attack 4. Credit Card Frauds 5. Cyber Pornography 6. Online Betting 7. Software Piracy 8. Email Spoofing

Hacking is an act committed by an intruder by accessing your computer system without your permission.Hackers (the people doing the ‘ hacking ’ ) are basically computer programmers, who have an advanced understanding of computers and commonly misuse this knowledge for devious reasons.

patterns: what is Denial of Service attack
responses: A Denial-of-Service (DoS) attack is an explicit attempt by attackers to deny service to intended users of that service. It involves flooding a computer resource with more requests than it can handle consuming its available bandwidth which results in server overload. This causes the resource (e.g. a web server) to crash or slow down significantly so that no one can access it. • Using this technique, the attacker can render a web site inoperable by sending massive amounts of traffic to the targeted site.

Trojans are pieces of malware allowing a hacker to remote access a computer system. They are not self-replicating and are not automated, so they need direct interaction with a hacker to fulfill their purpose. They operate without the permissions or knowledge of the computer users.

Credit card fraud is a wide ranging term for crimes involving identity theft where the criminal uses your credit card to fund his transactions. Credit card fraud is identity theft in its simplest form.
Cyber pornography can be defined as pornographic material designed, published or distributed using cyber space as a medium.

Federal law prohibits individuals from betting on sports or gambling contests which includes the Internet. Yet the Internet allows immediate and anonymous communication that makes it difficult to trace gambling activity. Internet sites can be altered or removed in a matter of minutes. For these reasons, organized crime operates Internet gambling sites.

Software piracy is the unauthorised use and distribution of computer software. Software developers work hard to develop these programs, and piracy curbs their ability to generate enoughrevenue to sustain application development.
Email spoofing is the forgery of an email header so that the message appears to have originated from someone or somewhere other than the actual source.
